summary: Electoral reform within the European Union context refers to the systematic modifications aimed at enhancing electoral procedures and voting mechanisms across member states. This concept encompasses a range of legal and regulatory initiatives designed to ensure fair representation, increase voter participation, and adapt to evolving democratic standards. Electoral reform may involve changes to voting systems, the establishment of uniform electoral regulations, and the promotion of transparency in electoral processes. By addressing disparities in electoral practices, the EU seeks to strengthen democratic legitimacy and uphold the foundational principles of participatory governance among its diverse member states.
